intro: Adicea rugosa, commonly known as the rough adicea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corona. Adicea rugosa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
